column1: lilacaes 161061758040 "2017-05-25 16:35:43 GMT" https://lilacaes.tumblr.com/post/161061758040/bubblineismyproblem-writing-prompt-s-everyone "bubblineismyproblem: writing-prompt-s: Everyone has the date of their death tattooed on their arm at birth
column2: however yours just says ‚ÄúTOMORROW‚Äù and has said that all your life. The confusion and anxiety started when I was first born; my parents were both in tears
column3: and all of the doctors offered their condolences.The next day
column5: much to the confusion of everyone involved. Maybe it was a mistake? Or I would die the next day instead.But I kept living.My parents taught me to hide it
column6: to lie about it. I always covered the tattoo up with long sleeves or ‚Äòbandages‚Äô during the summer. My mother had panic attacks regularly and rarely slept. My father insisted on always knowing where I was going
column7: and constantly checked up on me. I was never left alone.Eventually
column8: when I was old enough to understand what the tattoo meant
column10: the anxiety hit me too. I was constantly worried
column11: sometimes staring at the words late at night when I was alone in bed. It didn‚Äôt make any sense to me. It didn‚Äôt make sense to anyone. But my family and I had come to the agreement that under no circumstances was anyone to find out what the word on my arm really was.Throughout the years of my life
column12: the anxiety would come and go - why would I die now? But moments of fear still passed through me whenever I got into a car
column13: or a friend dared me to go on a roller coaster. Some people called me a coward. I wasn‚Äôt a coward - I was confused. I was just trying to live.A part of me knew I should be grateful
column14: grateful for living so long for no justified reason. But I was too confused to care.That is
column15: until one day in my philosophy class
column16: when we started discussing famous phrases and the meanings behind them. Class was normal - a little dull
column18: but interesting enough.Phrases entered and exited the discussion
column19: and I occasionally listened to the discussion. About ten minutes before we were suppose to leave
column20: the professor asked for one last phrase. A girl behind me raised her hand.‚ÄúYes? What‚Äôs your phrase?‚Äù‚ÄúMy phrase is ‚Äòtomorrow never comes.‚Äô‚ÄùThose words hit me
column22: making me struggle to breath. Class went on as normal as I sat there
column23: making sense of the words. How had I never heard that phrase before? I suppose my parents protected me from it. But how? It seems like a simple phrase that could be thrown around without anyone making much out of it. But then again
column24: I suppose there‚Äôs really not many opportunities to use it.Tomorrow never comes.Tomorrow never comes.Tomorrow never comes.What did that mean for me?I sat through the rest of my classes
column25: thinking and barely acknowledging my lessons
column26: eventually reaching the end of the school day. I reached into my pocket
column28: and went to text my dad the news. The statement. But as I typed the words
column29: the realization hit me. Everyone else had dates written on their arm. Dates like ‚ÄúSeptember 17
column31: 2100.‚Äù But tomorrow isn‚Äôt a date. Tomorrow isn‚Äôt a date.‚ÄúTomorrow never comes.‚ÄùI‚Äôm immortal. " False text

column1: lilacaes 160611804405 "2017-05-13 06:40:40 GMT" https://lilacaes.tumblr.com/post/160611804405/measles-making-comeback-as-parents-opt-out-of "violent-darts:  bonesnail:  lightspeedsound:  hyperzephyrianlives:  orgy-of-nerdiness:  shrewreadings:  writertobridge:  I am. So angry. Listen to me. I do not care whether or not you believe vaccines cause autism. Even though studies have shown time and time again that vaccines don‚Äôt cause autism and the original study stating that there was a link with autism and vaccines was fraudulent
column2: it does not matter. The reason that people are concerned about vaccines causing autism is because they‚Äôre not thinking of the long-term. Here‚Äôs the truth: when you are choosing to not having your child vaccinated because you‚Äôre afraid of autism
column3: you are actively choosing death over a neurodevelopmental disorder. Let me phrase that in another way ‚Äì you are either picking autism or death. It doesn‚Äôt have to be the death of your¬†child. It can be literally any child. And death is the worst case scenario. Autism is not the worst case scenario. Death is always and will constantly be the worst case scenario. There are children who are too young to get vaccines. There are kids who have compromised immune systems that cannot get vaccines. Your child getting vaccinated prevents these illnesses from spreading and keeps those children safe. It‚Äôs called community immunity and it‚Äôs important to maintain that so people don‚Äôt die. tl;dr - Stop being a selfish asshole and get your kids vaccinated. There are worse things in the world than autism. And before anyone starts coming to my inbox screaming about how¬†‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know how bad autism can be‚Äù
column4: I know. Not only do I have a neurodevelopmental disorder
column5: but I also had a friend with a severely autistic brother that could not talk when he was fifteen. I know. And even after witnessing him and being through my own shit
column6: I would still get my kids vaccinated because I want them
column9: people. Why the fuck do you think that your fear of autism (ungrounded
column11: beats someone else‚Äôs RIGHT TO LIVE?!?! You don‚Äôt want to vaccinate your kid. Goody gumdrops. You expose your godchild - who‚Äôs too young to be vaccinated. You expose your sister-in-law - who is going through chemo (because having cancer isn‚Äôt bad enough)
column12: and immunocompromised. You expose everyone they¬†come in contact with¬†- BECAUSE MEASLES STAYS ACTIVE FOR UP TO TWO HOURS ON SURFACES AND IN THE AIR OF A SPACE. Number of people killed by symptoms associated with autism diagnoses: 0. Number of people killed by measles in 2015: 134
column13: 000 Number of people killed per annum before vaccination became widespread in 1980: 2
column15: 000¬†(paraphrased from WHO). (Source: World Health Organization.¬†http://who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/fs286/en/) VACCINATE YOUR FUCKING KIDS.  Measles is not harmless. Researchers noticed that after the measles vaccine came out
column16: kids started dying less from other diseases as well. It turns out that measles suppresses your immune system for YEARS (and no
column17: no amount of vitamin C or zinc is going to make up for that).  Source (on mobile so these are going to be ugly links) NPR article (easier reading
column18: you don‚Äôt have to be a scientist): http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2015/05/07/404963436/scientists-crack-a-50-year-old-mystery-about-the-measles-vaccineArticle in Science (a very highly ranked journal): http://science.sciencemag.org/content/348/6235/694 VACCINATE YOUR FUCKING KIDS   Re blogging for the cartoon tho omfg  VACCINATE YOUR GODDAMN KIDS (And Yourself!)Sincerely-A pharmacist who has to deal with yearly people not getting their flu shots and then they endanger their babies.
